DC CODE § 1-623.17

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: An employee is not entitled to compensation or continuation of pay as provided in § 1-623.18 for the first 3 days of temporary disability which would have otherwise been workdays for the employee, except:
When the disability exceeds 14 calendar days;
When the disability is followed by permanent disability; or

An employee may use annual or sick leave to his or her credit at the time the disability begins but the time period specified in subsection (a) of this section does not begin to run until the use of annual or sick leave ends.
